fields.name: rev.com
fields.description: Remote transcribing company. Get paid to transcribe audio files. Rev.com offers training and practice audio files to get accustomed to the process of transcribing, and pay by the minute for work. The most committed "Revvers" can earn up to $1,400 a month - need internet access to complete.

fields.name: Remotive
fields.description: Several higher level telework / programming jobs that can be done from home. Sales, customer service, programming, design, and software development. Posted daily, free to join, hand select your gig!

fields.name: KForce
fields.description: Staffing agency that provides strategic partnership in the areas of technology and finance staffing. KForce also offers some remote work opportunities.

fields.name: National Retail Federation
fields.description: National Retail Federation lists retail companies across the US that are currently hiring.

fields.name: Lee Initiative
fields.description: Today they proudly have two programs under the LEE Initiative. The Women Chefs Initiative, a six month leadership development program for women chefs and The Smoke & Soul Initiative, a 40 week immersive restaurant mentorship program for young adults.

fields.name: United States Dept of Labor - Unemployment Insurance
fields.description: The U.S. Department of Labor's unemployment insurance programs provide unemployment benefits to eligible workers who become unemployed through no fault of their own and meet certain other eligibility requirements. Unemployment insurance is a joint state-federal program that provides cash benefits to eligible workers. Each state administers a separate unemployment insurance program, but all states follow the same guidelines established by federal law.

fields.name: United Way 2-1-1
fields.description: A nationwide organization that connects clients to resources and organizations local to them. Each United Way operates independently and as such, programming varies from location to location. Dial 2-1-1 to access resources near you.     ATLANTA ONLY:    United Way of Metro Atlanta- https://www.unitedwayatlanta.org/atlanta-covid-19-emergency-housing-assistance-program/ - The Atlanta COVID-19 Emergency Housing Assistance Program is available to incorporated City of Atlanta residents ONLY. Incorporated City of Atlanta residential renters who have experienced a loss of income because of COVID-19 will be able to receive assistance with the payment of their past due rent, utility and/or security deposit assistance dating back to March 13, 2020. Due to new federal guidelines, mortgage assistance will not be available.

fields.name: American Immigration Services
fields.description: A source for every aspect of the immigration process. Forms, how-to manuals, etc.

fields.name: Everest Funeral Planning and Concierge
fields.description: Assistance with funeral planning for families

fields.name: Families First
fields.description: Families First is Georgia's largest family and children's services organization in metro Atlanta. They work to improve outcomes for youth at every stage of life by providing them with mental health support, mentorship, early education, and supportive housing and strengthening families no matter what challenges they may be facing.

fields.name: DFS Memorials
fields.description: Funeral care and cremation services

fields.name: No Kid Hungry
fields.description: As a child hunger organization, ending childhood hunger is their primary focus, though Share Our Strength continues to invest in and develop other campaigns. They provide programs such as school breakfast, summer meals, afterschool meals, food skills education, research and policy, and advocacy.

fields.name: Red Rover
fields.description: RedRover staff and volunteers provide temporary emergency sheltering, resources, financial assistance and emotional support when animals and people are in crisis.

fields.name: Feeding America Food Banks Network
fields.description: Feeding America is a nationwide network of 200 food banks and 60,000 food pantries and meal programs that provides food and services to people each year.

fields.name: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)
fields.description: A federally-funded program that provides monthly benefits to low-income households to help pay for the cost of food. To be eligible for this program, applicants must live in the state in which they apply and meet certain bank balance limits. Click here for more information on eligibility. To apply, find your local SNAP office by selecting your state here.

fields.name: WIC
fields.description: The Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC)  - https://www.fns.usda.gov/wic - provides state funded assistance for supplemental foods, health care referrals, and nutrition education for low-income pregnant, breastfeeding, and non-breastfeeding postpartum women, and to infants and children up to age five who are found to be at nutritional risk.  To apply to be a WIC participant, you will need to contact your state or local agency to set up an appointment. Check out your state's website (GA: https://dph.georgia.gov/WIC / TN: https://www.tn.gov/health/health-program-areas/fhw/wic.html) or call the toll free number (GA: 1-800-228-9173 / TN: 1-800-342-5942). When you call to set up an appointment, someone will tell you the location nearest your home and what you need to bring with you.

fields.name: Veterans Affairs (VA)
fields.description: As a veteran with honorable service, you have access to a multitude of benefits offered by the Department of Veterans Affairs and other agencies. Their Resource Center explains the eligibility requirements for the various veterans’ benefits, how to apply for them, and how to get more information.

fields.name: Aging Life Care Association
fields.description: Aging Life Care™, also known as geriatric care management, is a holistic, client-centered approach to caring for older adults or others facing ongoing health challenges. Working with families, the expertise of Aging Life Care Professionals provides the answers at a time of uncertainty.

fields.name: Autism Spectrum Disorder Foundation
fields.description: Seeking to support the families of children with autism.  They have a variety of programs usually in the form of financial assistance.  There are also online resources for parents whose children have been diagnosed with autism.

fields.name: Department of Family and Children Services
fields.description: Offers assistance to Georgia families with children by way of food stamps, financial assistance, energy assistance, adoptions, fostering children, and reporting on child abuse or neglect.

fields.name: Forever Family
fields.description: Nationwide service that connects families and children with foster families.

fields.name: Salvation Army
fields.description: Faith-based, nationwide organization that provides various financial and social services to families in need.  Assistance includes food pantries, disaster relief, and more.

fields.name: Society of St. Vincent de Paul
fields.description: Faith-based organization that offers various services including food assistance, rent and utility assistance, and financial counseling. Services vary based on location. Contact your local Catholic church to see if they have a chapter or visit their website.

fields.name: Oblito
fields.description: Nationwide website compiling various crisis intervention resources by state.

fields.name: The Warrior Alliance
fields.description: The Warrior Alliance assists veterans by connecting them to Veteran Service Organizations, government agencies, businesses, educators, and other community resources to help them through their transition decisions.

fields.name: CoAbode
fields.description: Connects single moms with one-another to share resources and support.

fields.name: Supportive Services for Veterans (SSVF)
fields.description: The Veterans Inc. Supportive Services for Veterans (SSVF) and Veteran Families Program helps individuals and families who are experiencing homelessness or at risk of experiencing homelessness. SSVF assists with healthcare referrals, budgeting and money management, benefits assistance and advocacy, housing counseling and assistance, and offers financial assistance for rent, utilities, moving expenses, security deposits, transportation, childcare, emergency supplies and legal services. To qualify, an individual must be a veteran, or a veteran family, low income (that does not exceed 50% of your area's median income), and occupy permanent housing (whether you are permanently housed and trying to avoid eviction, or are experiencing homelessness but are scheduled to move into permanent housing within 90 days).

fields.name: FoodFinder
fields.description: Privately search on FoodFinder’s website for help near you. Use our map of 50,000+ free food programs to find help in your community.

fields.name: National Foundation for Credit Counseling
fields.description: NFCC member agencies provide financial reviews and education to more than a million consumers each year in person, over the phone, or online. Every NFCC member agency client receives comprehensive money management services based on their individual needs.

fields.name: Fannie Mae
fields.description: Provide access to reliable, affordable mortgage financing in all markets at all times.

fields.name: MusiCares Medical Network
fields.description: Provides a safety net of critical assistance for music people in times of need. MusiCares' services and resources cover a wide range of financial, medical, and personal emergencies.

fields.name: One Fair Wage Foundation
fields.description: One Fair Wage is providing cash assistance to restaurant workers, car service drivers, delivery workers, personal service workers and more. PayPal account requested and OFW instructs applicants to apply ONLY ONCE to prevent delays in processing.

fields.name: CreditKarma
fields.description: Debt Management app that allows clients to monitor their credit score and actively work to improve their financial situations at no cost. Also, CreditKarma allows clients to file federal and state taxes FOR FREE.

fields.name: TrueBill App
fields.description: Budgeting and financial planning app that guides clients to spend smarter, save money, and assist with canceling unwanted subscriptions, recurring payments, lower their bills, and get them refunds on fees and outages.

fields.name: Fifth Season Financial
fields.description: Helps provide financial assistance to families in crisis due to medical bills/procedures.  Must have a life insurance policy to apply.

fields.name: Need Help Paying Bills
fields.description: Provides a large range of information and resources to low-income individuals.  They themselves do not provide financial assistance but direct you to the appropriate organizations/resources.

fields.name: Rentassistance.us
fields.description: Connects you with various rent assistance programs by your zip code.

fields.name: United Healthcare Children's Foundation
fields.description: Offers applications for financial assistance for children 16 and younger undergoing costly medical procedures WITH insurance coverage through a commercial health plan. Visit the website for all eligibility requirements as well as grant exclusions.

fields.name: HealthWell Foundation
fields.description: Providing financial assistance to those needing medical services that they cannot afford. When health insurance is not enough, they fill the gap by assisting with copays, premiums, deductibles and out-of-pocket expenses.

fields.name: Non-Profit Industries (Social Serve)
fields.description: Offers a national call center that provides jobs to hard-to-employ people who then help others access affordable housing and supportive services in their communities.

fields.name: Red Robin Foundation
fields.description: Offers housing emergency relief for Red Robin employees in need.

fields.name: Ruby Has Heart Fund
fields.description: Offers housing emergency relief for Ruby Tuesday employees in need.

fields.name: Project Share
fields.description: Emergency assistance to individuals who need help with basic necessities, conducted through the Salvation Army. Eligibility details in link.

fields.name: Comcast Internet Essentials Package
fields.description: Internet Essentials from Comcast brings affordable high-speed internet at home for eligible households. 25 mbps, no term contract, no credit check, and in-home wifi. You can also apply to purchase a low-cost computer through Comcast as well.

fields.name: Restaurant Workers Community Foundation
fields.description: Supplying individual restaurant workers financial relief, as well as zero interest loans for restaurants to get back up and running. Directions to apply are on their website – you submit an application through their financial assistance partner, who is processing applications for them.

fields.name: USBG - United States Bartenders Guild
fields.description: USBG programs provide valuable education, training, and opportunities to network inside the hospitality industry.USBG National Charity Foundation - https://www.usbgfoundation.org/philanthropy-grants - 855-655-8724 - USBG's mission is to unite the hospitality community to advance professional bartending. They believe tending & owning bars is an honorable career choice. Their goal is to empower bartenders to take charge of their careers. They accomplish this through working with their committed partners to enrich the career advancement of their members through peer-to-peer learning, expert instruction, service projects, and competition. Chapters hold cocktail competitions, sponsor intimate seminars with internationally recognized brand representatives, and forge relationships between top bar talent in 50 cities and counting. They offer all their members opportunities to compete, travel around the world, and spread knowledge in the pursuit of elevating our craft.  USBG programs provide valuable education, training, and opportunities to network inside the hospitality industry. USBG also provides crisis assistance / emergency assistance to service industry professionals who have sudden or catastrophic life events that prevent them from maintaining financial security.

fields.name: Bottleshare
fields.description: Offers grants to both businesses and individuals employed in a brewery, winery, or distillery. They are currently offering micro-grants of up to $1,000, and serve the entire US. The first step of their application is online.

fields.name: Affordable Housing Online
fields.description: Affordable Housing Online provides information about housing assistance, low income apartments and other affordable housing opportunities. They provide the most complete database of Federal housing assistance and exhaustive affordable housing data for each state, county and city in America.

fields.name: Catholic Charities
fields.description: A national faith based group who offers the following services (and more): housing assistance, immigrant services, disaster aid, and food assistance.  Visit their website to find a ministry near you.

fields.name: Children of Restaurant Employees (CORE)
fields.description: A non-profit dedicated to financially assisting workers in the restaurant and beverage industry with children.

fields.name: LIHEAP
fields.description: Nationwide resource that assists low-income individuals by covering their energy bill costs.  Application process will vary by county, so visit the national website for more information.

fields.name: The Modest Needs Mission
fields.description: Nation-wide organization that offers financial assistance grants to those experiencing temporary crisis.  Register online and prepare to spend 30-45 minutes completing their grant application.

fields.name: Lifeline
fields.description: Providing phone services to low-income individuals.

fields.name: Esusu Rent Relief Fund
fields.description: Esusu is providing interest-free loans to individuals who have been impacted by a loss of income due to COVID-19. This fund is designed to safeguard renters while supporting tenants and landlords as we collectively navigate this crisis.

fields.name: Together Rising
fields.description: A worldwide non-profit that offers assistance to women, families, and children in times of crisis by providing one-time grants of funds or goods

fields.name: Community Action Partnership
fields.description: Community Action Partnerships exist across the entire US, and offer varying services depending on location of the agency. Typically, they specialize in offering furthering education opportunities, energy programs, weatherization projects, and sometimes child care and rent/utility assistance.

fields.name: Legal Shield
fields.description: LegalShield gives you the ability to talk to an attorney on any personal legal matter without worrying about high hourly costs.

fields.name: Peachford Hospital
fields.description: Our treatment team works together with patients and their family members, creating an individualized treatment plan to encourage the best possible outcome. We help individuals find and use the tools needed to empower themselves to be healthier and whole.

fields.name: National Drug & Alcohol Hotline
fields.description: 24-Hour assistance hotline for anyone experiencing drug or alcohol abuse.

fields.name: SMART Recovery
fields.description: SMART Recovery (Self-Management And Recovery Training) sponsors face-to-face meetings around the world and daily online meanings to help individuals overcome addictions or harmful habits by empowering them to customize their recovery based on what works for them.

fields.name: National Suicide Hotline
fields.description: 24-Hour crisis assistance for anyone contemplating suicide.

fields.name: National Domestic Violence Hotline
fields.description: 24-Hour Crisis Assistance for those experiencing domestic violence.

fields.name: Georgia Helpline
fields.description: A free 24/7 helpline providing mental health crisis assistance and access to mental health resources throughout the state of Georgia

fields.name: QPR Suicide Prevention Training
fields.description: Their mission is to save lives and reduce suicidal behaviors by providing innovative, practical and proven suicide prevention training.

fields.name: Patients Advocate Foundation
fields.description: Patient Advocate Foundation (PAF) is a national 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization which provides case management services and financial aid to Americans with chronic, life threatening and debilitating illnesses.

fields.name: Safety Net Foundation
fields.description: Patient assistance program to access Amgen medicines for free

fields.name: Good Rx
fields.description: This is an application that locates prices and discounts from 60,000 pharmacies

fields.name: Coast2CoastRx
fields.description: Free prescription discount card provided by township, city, and country governments - and by local United Way organizations. The program includes participation by U.S. pharmacies to provide annual savings up to 55%.

fields.name: Al-Anon
fields.description: Al‑Anon is a mutual support program for people whose lives have been affected by someone else’s drinking. By sharing common experiences and applying the Al-Anon principles, families and friends of alcoholics can bring positive changes to their individual situations, whether or not the alcoholic admits the existence of a drinking problem or seeks help.

fields.name: American Diabetes Association
fields.description: The ADA is a United States-based nonprofit that seeks to educate the public about diabetes and to help those affected by it by funding research to manage, cure and prevent diabetes.

fields.name: Cancer Financial Assistance Coalition
fields.description: Helps patients get information on organizations that assist with cancer costs, treatments, or diagnoses.  Provides specialized resources dependent on what you need help with (co-pays, transportation, etc.).

fields.name: Chron's & Colitis Foundation
fields.description: Offers support groups as well as camps for children for families experiencing IBD.

fields.name: GoodPill.org
fields.description: Home delivery service helping low-income individuals access prescriptions and medications. New patients get any number of medications all for $6.

fields.name: Planned Parenthood
fields.description: Offering resources and medical care concerning reproductive and sexual health.

fields.name: Medicaid
fields.description: Public healthcare coverage for those in need who qualify.

fields.name: KHealth
fields.description: Digital / telehealth primary care as low as $9 a month – with referrals to specialists if needed. 24 hour access, no limit on questions you can ask, also free to use. Symptom screeners help clients decide whether speaking with a doctor is necessary AHEAD of time, and if connected to a doctor, they are linked to a physician within $19. Client can then text with their doctor up to two weeks for no additional charge.

fields.name: Family Reach Foundation
fields.description: dedicated to removing the financial barriers standing between a cancer patient and their treatment. Loss of income, out-of-pocket expenses, and socioeconomic factors create disparities in the financial burdens families face. Family Reach delivers financial education, financial planning, resource navigation, and emergency relief funds to patients and caregivers facing a cancer diagnosis so no family has to choose between their health and their home

fields.name: Patient Advocate Foundation Co-Pay Relief
fields.description: Direct payment for co-pays, co-insurance and deductibles for patients who need financial assistance.

fields.name: CancerCare Co-Payment Assistance Foundation
fields.description: This organization helps people with cancer overcome financial access and treatment barriers by assisting them with their co-payments for their prescribed treatments.

fields.name: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA)
fields.description: The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) is the agency within the US Department of Health and Human Services that leads public health efforts to advance the behavioral health of the nation. Their mission is to reduce the impact of substance abuse and mental illness on America's communities. They do this through educational programs that span a multitude of mental health diagnoses, substance abuse diagnoses, working to create equity in access to mental healthcare across all communities, and connecting clients / patients with providers and solutions through their National Helpline.

fields.name: Alcoholics Anonymous
fields.description: AA is an international fellowship of those who have had a drinking problem. It is nonprofessional, self-supporting, multiracial, apolitical, and available almost everywhere. There are no age or education requirements. Membership is open to anyone who wants to do something about their drinking problem.

fields.name: Ben's Friends
fields.description: A support group for members of the food and beverage industry suffering with substance and alcohol abuse.  Aiming to help food service workers reach and maintain sobriety. Several locations across the US, so visit their website!

fields.name: Atlanta Detox Center
fields.description: Offers rehabilitation and detoxification for those suffering from addiction in the Atlanta area.

fields.name: I Support The Girls
fields.description: Organization that provides bras and feminine hygiene products to women experiencing homelessness.

fields.name: Parents Without Partners (PWP)
fields.description: PWP is a single parent support group for all single parents and their children. PWP is a 501.C3 educational organization promoting single parents and their children. This program offers support, education, and a safe environment for single parents and their children. While this organization does not provide financial assistance, they may be a good source of helpful referrals for single mothers.

fields.name: Giving Kitchen COVID-19 Resources
fields.description: An exhaustive list of local, statewide, and national resources available to those affected by COVID-19.

fields.name: Ben Massell Dental Clinic
fields.description: Needs-based dental services. Extractions and oral surgeries provided by volunteer dentists.  There are certain qualifications to receive this care.  You must have no dental insurance and an income at least 125% below the poverty line.  Lastly, you must provide proof of residence for at least six months in one of the following counties: Butts, Cherokee, Clayton, Cobb, Coweta, DeKalb, Douglas, Fayette, Fulton, Gwinnett, Henry, Paulding, Rockdale

fields.name: Prevent Blindness Georgia
fields.description: Prevent blindness and preserve sight for all Georgians, so that no Georgian needlessly lose their sight due to preventable vision loss.

fields.name: Dental Clinics
fields.description: Resource that refers you to nationwide community dentists and affordable dental clinics.

fields.name: Savannah Technical College Dental Clinic
fields.description: Offers reduced-rate dental hygiene services to those in need. The Dental Hygiene Clinic is located at the Savannah campus. Parking is available in the back of the campus near the Eckburg Auditorium. Clinic hours vary each semester. Please call the clinic 912-443-5351 to make an appointment.

fields.name: Urban League of Greater Atlanta
fields.description: The League’s focus is preparing the workforce for careers in the 21st century and the new economy; raising the graduation rate among metro Atlanta students and preparing youth for college and careers; homeownership and wealth creation; entrepreneurship and small business growth; sustainable communities; and serving as an advocate for education, civic engagement and economic development and a voice for the underserved in our community.    Provides job search and vocational training assistance including job matching support for African American / Black clients seeking employment.

fields.name: Juvo Jobs
fields.description: Employment locator app that puts users in touch with employment opportunities near them.

fields.name: WorkSource DeKalb
fields.description: Offering occupational skill training to reduce unemployment and increase the earnings of DeKalb County residents. Some programs offering compensation for training or apprenticeships.

fields.name: Giving Kitchen Facebook Page
fields.description: A moderated Facebook group for food and beverage service workers to communicate and share resources.

fields.name: Goodwill of Middle GA & the CSRA
fields.description: We build lives, families and communities one career at a time by helping people develop their God-given gifts through education, work and career services.

fields.name: Friends of Gwinnett Seniors
fields.description: This service assists seniors with transportation access, emergency assistance, food assistance, and home repairs.

fields.name: Open Hand Atlanta
fields.description: Open Hand serves men, women and children with unique nutrition needs. Open Hand's programs and services are designed to help empower our clients with the tools and knowledge they need to better manage their health. and assist healthcare providers in the early identification and treatment, as well as the prevention or progression, of many nutrition-sensitive illnesses. Provides healthy prepared meals for low-income clients

fields.name: Latin American Association - Atlanta
fields.description: Offers immigrants the tools and resources they need to improve their lives through a wide variety of services.

fields.name: Clayton County Aging Program
fields.description: Currently partners with Program Open Hands who brings chilled meals and frozen lunches for Clayton Senior Adult Program participants at the Frank Bailey Senior Center.

fields.name: Cobb County Senior Services
fields.description: Their primary goal is to assist clients in their efforts to remain independent through affordable transportation, nutrition, recreation, education, socialization and in home services.

fields.name: Atlanta Legal Aid
fields.description: Helps low-income people meet their basic needs through free civil legal services.

fields.name: Common Courtesy, Inc.
fields.description: A program which began as a way to help poor, elderly medical patients get to and from hospitals and has been re-purposed to get homeless people rides to warming shelters. In partnership with Central Atlanta Progress and rideshare services such as Lyft and Uber.

fields.name: Disability Link
fields.description: Provide information and assistance for people with disabilities and their families in accessing support systems, and promoting changes that enhance full access to the community.

fields.name: The Silverton Foundation
fields.description: Provides mortgage and rent assistance to families who are experiencing financial hardship due to their child (or children) under 18 being diagnosed with serious illness or hospitalization. To apply, reach out through their Contact page and request an application.

fields.name: Meals on Wheels
fields.description: Meal delivery for low-income and homebound seniors; pet pantry for animals

fields.name: Real Life Center
fields.description: Holistic support and assistance for Fayette and Coweta county residents through several services including mobile food pantries, educational classes, career and job coaching. Clients can enroll in the Full Program, which is a year long initiative that grants the client access to services such as good, seasonal programs, clothes, basic necessities, financial counseling and assistance, educational classes, resume assistance, etc. The Introductory program, which includes a subset of services, gives client access to food, seasonal programming, financial counseling, and educational courses. The requirements for each program vary. For more details and to learn how to enroll, call 770-631-9334 (Monday 9AM for Coweta County residents, Tuesday 9AM for Fayette county residents).

fields.name: AHIMSA House
fields.description: Organization dedicated to helping the human and animal victims of domestic violence reach safety together.

fields.name: Paws Between Homes
fields.description: Organization that keeps fur companions safe while owners transition to stable housing. Serve low-income families in zip codes 30310, 30311, 30312, 30314, 30315, 30318, and 30331.

fields.name: Tapestri
fields.description: Provides casework, crisis counseling, legal advocacy, and pro-bono attorneys for those who are victims of domestic abuse in immigrant and refugee communities. Tapestri also offers a family violence intervention program, victim assistance for those who are victims of human trafficking, and assistance with providing care and shelter to unaccompanied children. Provides legal advocacy in assistance in obtaining temporary protective order and connect clients to partners that help with legal matters, child support and custody, divorce and immigration proceedings. Has more than 15 languages available, and oversees survivors in Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina, and Tennessee.
fields.address1: Mailing- PMB 362 3939 Lavista Rd. Suite E

fields.name: Good Neighbor Ministries
fields.description: Non-profit that is devoted to sharing God's love with persons in immediate need in Rome and Floyd County. They help people with rent, utilities, work clothes, medications, food and even simple household items such as cleaning supplies, laundry detergent and even toilet paper.

fields.name: Area Churches Together Serving (ACTS)
fields.description: ACTS provides assistance with food (pantry), clothing, medical and utility assistance and housewares/furniture for referrals from Cumbee Center, Nurture Home, My Father’s House in addition to victims of residential house fires and other disasters referred by Red Cross. A Senior Food Program is also available for qualifying seniors on the 3rd Saturday of every month from 8:00 am to 9:30 am. Distribution is provided in Aiken, Jackson, Wagener, and Graniteville.

fields.name: Atlanta Community Food Bank
fields.description: The Atlanta Community Food Bank has a team whose job it is to help folks apply for all the government benefits to which they’re entitled. They have a higher success rate than if you applied on your own because they do it full time. ACFB also offers food assistance.

fields.name: Atlanta Victim Assistance
fields.description: Atlanta based organization that assists families who have experienced child abuse, domestic violence, homicide, or identity theft.

fields.name: Standing with Our Neighbors
fields.description: An Atlanta Volunteer Lawyers Foundation program designed to provide housing stability and better living conditions for families and children. They are concerned with issues at the intersection of housing, education, and health. Services often include placing an attorney in Atlanta Public Schools so families have direct access to legal aid.  This place-based program seeks to overhaul the typical legal services model in favor of something more accessible and equitable. This program partners Atlanta Volunteer Lawyers Foundation with schools and other community allies to focus AVLF’s volunteer resources on improving living conditions and housing stability in low-income neighborhoods – all to improve resident health, reduce school enrollment turnover, and enhance student attendance and performance. All of their program staff is embedded within neighborhoods to stop housing instability early and work as a first responder when problems do arise.

fields.name: AutoGift
fields.description: A program designed to provide single mothers or (2) or more children with transportation. The application process is involved, requires a great deal of documentation, and requires a referral from a case manager to apply. You must be assigned a Giving Kitchen case manager to apply for this service.

fields.name: Camp Cocoon
fields.description: Camps across Georgia for children ages 5 and above who have suffered the loss of a loved one.  Helps children through bereavement and understand loss.  Spring, summer, and fall dates and registration can be found on their website.

fields.name: Childcare and Parent Services
fields.description: Georgia program assisting families in affording and receiving child care.  Aims to help low-income families reach self-sufficiency and prepare children for early learning.
fields.address1: 19 Martin Luther King Jr. Drive SW

fields.name: Georgia Division of Child Support Services
fields.description: Provides various programs to Georgia families with children, including assistance in applying for child support, child visitation information, and more.

fields.name: Enrichment Services Program
fields.description: Aiding low-income families through a range of services such as Head Start programs, financial assisstance, and more.

fields.name: Fayette Samaritans
fields.description: Food assistance for registered residents of Fayette County, Georgia.

fields.name: Feeding the Valley Food Bank
fields.description: Provides food assistance through various partner agencies across West Georgia and some of Alabama.

fields.name: Georgia Citizens Coalition on Hunger
fields.description: Helping reduce homelessness and poverty in the Atlanta-area through various programs including a food pantry.

fields.name: Georgia Department of Early Care and Learning
fields.description: Statewide department providing various forms of education/development assistance and childcare.
fields.address1: 2 Martin Luther King Jr. Drive SE

fields.name: Helping Hands of Paulding County
fields.description: A faith-based group providing various ways of poverty-reduction to residents of Paulding County.  Services include a food pantry, financial services, family support, and more.

fields.name: Kate's Club
fields.description: Helping provide support systems and therapy for families and children experiencing grief.

fields.name: Mothers Offering Resources and Education (M.O.R.E.)
fields.description: A DeKalb County resource connecting people who are pregnant/have children less than a year old with mothers equipped to provide emotional support, medical advice, and more.

fields.name: Our Giving Garden
fields.description: Community garden fighting food insecurity and offering food assistance to those in need.

fields.name: Quality Child Care
fields.description: Helping families in Georgia have access to affordable, quality child care to prepare them for learning environments.

fields.name: Rural Outreach Center
fields.description: Provides emergency food assistance to residents of Southern Erie, Wyoming, and Cattaraugus counties.  They also provide further resource referrals for residents.

fields.name: The Sparrow's Nest
fields.description: is a faith-based organization that offers a variety of stability programs:  · Emergency food assistance for those in need. · Hot meals for families in crisis · Facilities for those experiencing homelessness to shower and wash their clothes. · Provide financial assistance with prescription medication, obtaining a GA ID or birth certificate as well as addiction recovery services and referrals to other local agencies.

fields.name: St. Martin's Outreach / Suthers Center
fields.description: Ministry providing a variety of services including addiction support, homelessness prevention, food pantry, and more. Food pantry services available only on Saturdays, from 8AM to 10AM. More details available in link provided.

fields.name: STARline of Fulton County
fields.description: is a free information and referral service for Fulton County seniors aged 60 and above, their families, caregivers, and the community. The STARline helps seniors who want to remain in their homes to “age in place” through referrals to service providers and serves as a gateway for community resources. Please call the STARline at 404-613-6000 from 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday through Friday to speak to a specialist. If you are unable to reach a specialist, please leave a message, your phone call will be returned within 24 hours.

fields.name: Sweetwater Mission
fields.description: A group of churches in northern Georgia offering various stabilizing services such as clothing and food assistance, employment assistance, and more. Walk-in services for food and clothing are Monday through Saturday, 9AM - 12:30PM. In order to determine eligibility, bring proof of residency (sent within thirty days of your visit) in the form of mail, a rent receipt, or a new lease, bring Photo ID and SSC or birth certificate for you and members of your household, and qualify based on your total household income.

fields.name: Tallatoona Community Action Partnership
fields.description: Offers various services to residents in northwest Georgia including Head Start / Early Start programs, GED payment assistance, LIHEAP / energy efficiency services, weatherization services, and more.

fields.name: ToCo Hills Community Alliance
fields.description: Food pantry offered to residents of the ToCo Hills neighborhood in Atlanta. Current COVID-19 protocols: Serving the public Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday from 1PM-4PM with registration starting at 12:45PM; face masks are required and must be worn either in your car or in the walk-up line. Clothing closet available to families once a month by appointment only. Accessible via MARTA Number 30 bus route that originates from Lindbergh Station. Bring a form of ID. Serving zip codes 30030, 30032, 30033, 30319, 30324, 30329, 30340, 30341, 30345.

fields.name: Embrace Florida Kids
fields.description: A faith-based, nonprofit organization that is a ministry of United Methodist Children's Home and works with vulnerable children and families through programs like family preservation, foster care, and adoption in the state of Alabama.

fields.name: Veteran's Empowerment Organization
fields.description: Provides housing, addiction recovery and mental health services as well as workforce income. To get help, call 404-889-8710 or email help@veohero.org

fields.name: Wesley Community Centers of Savannah
fields.description: Wesley’s Early Childhood Education and Development Center is a Georgia Quality Rated Center that serves up to 48 disadvantaged children, ages 1-4. Degreed teaching staff follows Creative Curriculum to find the best in each child and promote self-worth, creativity, and family support. Activities include field trips, computer centers, guest speakers, and Healthy Living Initiative classes. Wesley works with the public school system to host a variety of on-site therapy programs for children with differing abilities and/or emotional issues. The Center is in 100% compliance with Bright From the Start: Georgia Department of Early Care and Learning regulations and child immunizations.    Wesley Centers also offer GED classes / adult education classes, a food pantry, and emergency food assistance is on the first Wednesday of each month at 10:00 am. For crisis intervention services, please call (912) 447-5711

fields.name: Wholesome Wave
fields.description: Wholesome Wave - 404-551-5996  - https://www.wholesomewavegeorgia.org/ - doubles values of food stamps at farmer's markets through their Fresh for Less program and performs SNAP screenings; also does fruit and veggie prescriptions across Georgia. Call for the over-the-phone SNAP/EBT application assistance. To see all participating Fresh for Less locations, click here.

fields.name: Fresh MARTA Markets - ACFB
fields.description: A pop-up farm stand that takes place in five MARTA public transport stations. The goal is simple: help farmers sell more produce while getting healthy, fresh food into places where people already are.

fields.name: New Life Community Ministries
fields.description: This agency offers an array of services that include financial assistance, counseling, hot meals, food pantry, transitional housing, and more.

fields.name: Lilburn Cooperative Ministry
fields.description: Food pantries, funds for emergency needs (as available), clothing closet, employment resources and referrals, school supplies, counseling referrals. Days/Hours of Service: Mon, Wed, Fri 10 am – 2 pm.

fields.name: North Gwinnett Cooperative Ministry
fields.description: Food distributed twice a month to families with children 18 or younger - requires a photo ID for entry. Utility assistance - maximum of 150.00 per client in a 12 month period, and must have received a shut off notice. They do not cover telephone bills, deposits, or reconnect fees. If fee is over $150.00, client must pay down outstanding balance before North Gwinnett will cut a check. Prescription medicine assistance - 100.00 every 2 months. Also have a variety of holiday programs.

fields.name: Hope Haven of Northeast Georgia
fields.description: Offer home services, community services, and supported employment for individuals with developmental disabilities and their families.

fields.name: Jewish Family and Career Services Atlanta (JF&CS)
fields.description: JF+CS offers counseling services, older adult services, intellectual and developmental disability services, career services, and support services to Jewish and non-Jewish families.

fields.name: Embrace Alabama Kids
fields.description: A faith-based, nonprofit organization that is a ministry of United Methodist Children's Home and works with vulnerable children and families through programs like family preservation, foster care, and adoption in the state of Alabama.

fields.name: Pro Management Group
fields.description: Restaurant financial solutions

fields.name: Clearpoint Credit Counseling Solutions
fields.description: Free financial literacy education for individuals struggling with debt

fields.name: Economic Opportunity Authority for Savannah-Chatham County
fields.description: A Savannah-area non-profit seeking to provide financial assistance to individuals and families.  Services include employment assistance, utility assistance, housing help, and more.

fields.name: Grady Financial Assistance Program
fields.description: A program through Grady Health system where one can apply for financial assistance for necessary medical procedures.

fields.name: Heard That Foundation
fields.description: Providing financial support for Dallas-area service workers in the event of a medical emergency.

fields.name: Neighborhood Cooperative Ministries
fields.description: Faith-based group offering various forms of emergency assistance to those in need in southwest Gwinnett County.

fields.name: Piedmont Financial Assistance
fields.description: Fill out a financial assistance application to see if you qualify for financial assistance towards medical expenses at any Piedmont Healthcare hospital.

fields.name: Rockdale Emergency Relief
fields.description: Helps meet the needs of Rockdale residents. Services include homelessness prevention, toiletries, food assistance, and more.

fields.name: Latino Community Fund Georgia
fields.description: A 501(c)(3) Latinx membership organization serving as a philanthropic intermediary and providing specific direct services and programs.  We fund power-building strategies, program development, and capacity building in Georgia.

fields.name: Cherokee Residential Services
fields.description: Cherokee Residential Services is a low-income housing apartment for those with disabilities.

fields.name: Atlanta Gas Light "Home and Heartwarming Program"
fields.description: Helps low to moderate income pay their utility and energy bills.

fields.name: Star-C
fields.description: A non-profit that works with landlords to help keep tenants in their home and reduce transiency in the Cobb county community. Star-C also has four apartment communities they extend wrap-around services to (community gardens, after-school care, and other holistic care services).    They are also offering a current eviction relief program, but it requires participation from both the Landlord and the Tenant. If you think your landlord may be willing to participate, you can access more information on the link provided.

fields.name: Partnership for Community Action
fields.description: Emergency housing-needs assistance to low-income families; youth empowerment program that assists with college prep and extra-curricular activities for high school students

fields.name: Another Chance
fields.description: Provides housing and support to homeless Veterans, families, and individuals.

fields.name: Carroll Electric Membership Corporation
fields.description: Helps those over 65 years old pay their utility and energy bills.

fields.name: Furniture Bank of Metro Atlanta
fields.description: Provides gently used furniture to low-income families and families transitioning out of homelessness. Serves within 50 miles of their location.

fields.name: Gas South
fields.description: Helps those over 65 years old pay their utility and energy bills.

fields.name: Making A Way
fields.description: Addresses the growing epidemic of homelessness in metropolitan Atlanta through its shelters.

fields.name: Fulton Atlanta Community Action Authority
fields.description: Emergency housing-needs assistance to low-income families; Vision healthcare assistance program

fields.name: Initiative for Affordable Housing DeKalb
fields.description: Families live for up to two years in Initiative-owned single family houses and apartments in safe, stable neighborhoods where children can attend local schools. With their support, families get jobs, earn income, practice new skills and ultimately move into their own independent housing.

fields.name: Midtown Assistance Center
fields.description: Midtown Assistance Center (MAC) is a non-profit whose mission is to provide emergency assistance to low-income working Atlantans to help prevent homelessness and hunger during periods of crisis. Provides assistance for rent payments (eviction protection), utility bills (disconnection prevention), food/groceries, MARTA cards for employment.

fields.name: North Metro Group Homes Assn Inc
fields.description: A 6 unit low-income housing apartment community in Roswell for seniors. Some or all apartments in this community are rent subsidized, which means rent is income based.

fields.name: The Heating Energy Assistance Team (HEAT)
fields.description: Helps low to moderate income families pay their utility and energy bills. To help families and individuals in need, HEAT works with the Georgia Division of Family and Children Services (DFCS) to distribute energy assistance funds through community action agencies. Eligible residents can apply for help at the local community action agency that serves their county.

fields.name: UCP of Atlanta
fields.description: United Cerebral Palsy (UCP) of Georgia offers a range of community living options to enable adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities to live in residential settings which best meet their individual choices and needs. These options are designed to help individuals become as independent as possible and enjoy full access to all aspects of community life. UCP community living options include single family houses, host homes and supported living.

fields.name: Home Stretch
fields.description: Offers working homeless families a proven path toward financial stability, improved employment, stronger family relationships and permanent affordable housing.

fields.name: Coweta-Fayette Electric Membership Corporation
fields.description: Helps low to moderate income pay their utility and energy bills.

fields.name: Partners for Home
fields.description: Pulls together nonprofit, government, and business leaders to zero in on a shared, consistent, and measured approach toward success.
fields.address1: The Gateway Center 275 Pryor Street SW

fields.name: Atlanta Children's Shelter
fields.description: To provide loving, quality child development and support services for families experiencing homelessness and striving to become self-sufficient.

fields.name: Clayton County Community Services Authority
fields.description: Emergency housing-needs assistance to low-income families

fields.name: The Center for Family Resources
fields.description: Center for Family Resources is based in Marietta and serves those experiencing homelessness and low to moderate income families to encourage their self-sufficiency. Services offered include financial assistance for rent, utility bills, and a food pantry.

fields.name: Supreme Lending
fields.description: Loan officer partner with a desire to assist food service workers in securing a home. Offers two or three loan programs to help secure housing for those with less ability to put cash down.

fields.name: California Restaurant Association (Restaurants Care Foundation)
fields.description: Organization based in California that provides assistance for food services workers experiencing illness, injury, death of an immediate family member, or a fire or flood to the home.

fields.name: Networks Cooperative Ministry
fields.description: Co-op Ministry that provides food assistance in crisis, 2x a month and only in certain areas (Northlake, Embry Hills and Tucker) Also provides assistance in housing and utilities. Provides classes to teach financial stability (manages house hold budget, managing debt, saving, etc)

fields.name: North Fulton Community Charities
fields.description: Provides assistance to N. Fulton area (Alpharetta, Johns Creek, Milton, Mt. Park, and Roswell) with short-term emergency needs. Food pantry available by appointment only. Provides direct aid to the providers for rent, utilities, medical, transportation, and other basic needs on an emergency basis. Must schedule to meet with caseworker for assistance. Thrift shop- sells donated clothing, clients receive monthly clothing voucher or allowance. Provides education for financial stability, offers free adult basic education, English classes, GED test preparation (classes are free in the evenings and weekend)

fields.name: Mercy Housing
fields.description: Affordable housing process, project financing and housing development to community outreach for long-term resident services. Service to low-income families, seniors, and people with special needs.

fields.name: Atlanta Housing Search
fields.description: Facebook page with listings, subleases, roommates, etc. They tend to have more private listings and not the mega apartment complexes you’ll see on Craigslist or Zillow.

fields.name: Promove
fields.description: Website that helps find apartments within budget.

fields.name: Atlanta Mission
fields.description: Works to end homelessness, one person at a time, via a holistic approach — addressing the physical, emotional, and spiritual needs of their guests. They have five facilities, each serving the needs of different segments of the homeless population. They serve men, women, and children who have lost jobs, faced eviction, been abused, battled addictions, fought mental illness, and much more.

fields.name: The Nicholas House
fields.description: family friendly shelter who assists clients by offering a safe place to stay as well as education + training on financial responsibility and referral to more permanent housing. Go to the Gateway Center (275 Pryor Street, Atlanta, GA 30312, Monday-Friday 9 am – 4 pm) Ask the front desk for a housing assessment. Assessments are provided on a first-come, first-served basis. Note that this location also serves as a single men’s shelter, but it is the designated assessment center for families and all others seeking housing services within City of Atlanta limits. They do not accept calls about housing assessments - you must go in person.

fields.name: Our House
fields.description: Provides education for children experiencing homelessness, families with newborn children and other family services such as early childhood education, employment training, and housing. Multi-unit complex with other families sharing.

fields.name: The Drake House
fields.description: Short-term housing for women and children. Providing housing and educational programs for families recovering from homelessness. Provides a communal home with others families and bringing a sense of support to all families. 90-180 days with case management, career coaching. Transitional, temporary support or permanent housing with a flat rate. Community provides child and men programs after school during the school year. Life skills and education given to mothers.

fields.name: The Elizabeth Inn
fields.description: All Elizabeth Inn guests are provided services to meet both immediate needs (food, clothing, shelter) and long-term needs (employment assistance, support groups, etc.). Intake is conducted on a "first come, first served" basis. You must have a photo ID for entry. MUST Ministries family shelter located in Marietta. Intake is 11AM - 2PM, 55 Elizabeth Church Road Marietta, GA, 30060

fields.name: MUST Ministries
fields.description: A non-profit organization in Cobb County that helps with housing, seeking employment, clothing, food pantry, marketplace (vouchers to buy donated items), summer lunch for kids in need and a toy shop for the holidays.

fields.name: Angel Relief Fund
fields.description: Non-profit organization that helps foodservice workers in crisis in Colorado. Injury, Illness, death of immediate family, disaster.

fields.name: Lawrenceville Cooperative Ministry
fields.description: Organization that helps citizens of Gwinnett County. Some services they offer are food bank, limited medical and dental care, clothing voucher.

fields.name: Athens Housing Authority
fields.description: The Athens Housing Authority (AHA) offers an affordable housing option for low-income families through its public housing program.

fields.name: Ben Hill United Methodist Church
fields.description: Ben Hill United Methodist Church's Financial Assistance Program provides housing and utility assistance to those in the Ben Hill community (ZIP code 30331).

fields.name: Buckhead Christian Ministries
fields.description: Provides various services.  Their helpline assists with rent, mortgage, and utilities assistance.  Walk-in services include a food pantry and hygiene items, clothing, access to computers and internet, as well as employment services.  Appointments may be made to assist with finances and housing and utilities crises.

fields.name: Caring Works
fields.description: Working to prevent homelessness and hunger among adult men, especially those facing hardship related to substance abuse.  They offer a range of services, from residential treatment, to help in finding long-term housing.

fields.name: Chatham-Savannah Authority for the Homeless
fields.description: A Savannah group dedicated to mitigating and reducing homelessness in the area.  Services include resource referral for shelter and housing access as well as individual case workers.

fields.name: Chattahoochee Valley Episcopal Ministry, Inc.
fields.description: A faith-based group that offers financial assistance towards things like medical care, housing, job-related expenses, etc.

fields.name: City of Refuge
fields.description: Faith-based organization that provides crisis assistance in the form of housing assistance, food, medical assistance, and more.

fields.name: Community Action for Improvement
fields.description: Provides resources and access to various services for low-income families.  Resources include medical assistance, job training, assistance in job search, and more.

fields.name: Community Assistance Center
fields.description: CAC may be able to help if you are experiencing a crisis such as illness, job loss or divorce and need emergency financial assistance. CAC provides financial assistance to pay portion of rent, mortgage or utility bills or other emergency situations. Clients can receive assistance once a year

fields.name: Decatur-Area Emergency Assistance Ministry, Inc.
fields.description: Decatur-based group providing food, utility, and rent assistance.

fields.name: Decatur Cooperative Ministry
fields.description: Providing homelessness mitigation and prevention to DeKalb County residents.  Additionally, they have hunger alleviation programs.

fields.name: Georgia Department of Community Affairs
fields.description: One of their missions is to ensure that Georgians have access to stable, affordable housing.  Their website offers various resources in Georgia to find housing.

fields.name: Hands of Christ Duluth Co-Op
fields.description: A faith-based group offering various emergency assistance services to residents of Duluth, Georgia. Their food pantry is open Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM

fields.name: Elizabeth Inn
fields.description: Offering faith-based, short-term and long-term housing assistance for those in Cobb County.

fields.name: Faith Works
fields.description: Faith-based group providing rent and utility assistance to residents of Newton County.

fields.name: Gateway Center
fields.description: Provides access to critical services and housing for those experiencing homelessness in our community such as coordinated entry, basic needs services (i.e. showers, clothing closet, etc.), short-term residential housing (shelter), linkage to healthcare (medical, behavioral, and dental), and employment resources. Regular program admission occurs Monday through Friday at 7:00 am and operates on a first come, first serve basis. Because they can’t anticipate program availability in advance and program spots are in high demand, they recommend arriving early. This facility is committed to sober living – substance abuse and alcohol abuse are not permitted. Though this is a men's shelter, they assist with locating other rooms throughout the local shelters. Women and families can report here to try to secure a room elsewhere.

fields.name: HOPE Atlanta
fields.description: Helps people experiencing homelessness through each stage of homelessness.  They provide short-term/crisis aid and help find long-term solutions.

fields.name: Hosea Helps
fields.description: Hosea Helps raise awareness about families and individuals who or living in, or at risk of slipping into poverty. They face diverse problems that Hosea Helps investigate and then mobilize financial resources, products, and volunteers to stabilize those households.  Their current program offerings include:    ·Rental Assistance   ·Utility Assistance  ·Employment Assistance   ·Emergency Shelter  ·Emergency Food  ·Fresh Produce  ·Community Service Hours  ·SNAP Benefits    Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday 10 AM - 12 PM. Call first to secure an appointment: 404-755-3353.

fields.name: Lift Up Atlanta
fields.description: Homelessness prevention services and food assistance to residents of the Metro-Atlanta area.

fields.name: NSPIRE
fields.description: Offering aid to those experiencing homelessness in the Gwinnett County area.  They provide additional services such as clothing, employment assistance, and more.

fields.name: Perry Volunteer Outreach
fields.description: Providing emergency financial assistance for housing, medical needs, and more to those in need in the south Houston County area.

fields.name: Project Community Connections
fields.description: Project Community Connections, Inc. (PCCI) is a non-profit organization that builds relationships with property owners, government agencies, and community organizations to help clients become self-sufficient, so they can remain stably housed and thrive in all aspects of their lives.

fields.name: ProMove
fields.description: Helping simplify the process of finding an affordable apartment in the Metro-Atlanta area.  Contact a Giving Kitchen case manager for more information.

fields.name: Reentry Partnership Housing
fields.description: Statewide organization providing stable housing to those on parole or under probation.

fields.name: St. Anne's Community Outreach
fields.description: Ministry providing a variety of services in Columbus, included food assistance, clothing assistance, limited rent and utility assistance, and medical assistance. To enroll in the rental assistance program, call 706-568-1592 beginning at 11 AM on the THIRD Tuesday of the month. Families with eviction notices are given priority for this financial assistance program.

fields.name: The Ark
fields.description: Providing budget counseling, financial education, transportation assistance, prescriptions, rent and/or utility assistance for residents in Clarke, Madison, Oglethorpe, and Madison counties. Call 706-458-8155 between 9AM-12:30PM Monday-Friday to determine eligibility.

fields.name: The Place of Forsyth County
fields.description: Financial assistance (in the form of rent, utilities, medical appointments or prescriptions, transportation or other basic needs), food assistance, workforce development, and senior assistance for residents of Forsyth county.

fields.name: Transitional Housing For Offender Reentry
fields.description: Statewide program offering communal, transitional housing for those recently released from prison, on parole, or on probation. Shares locations across major cities in Georgia through two formats of housing: Recovery and Structured.

fields.name: Best Western Plus Roswell
fields.description: Best Western Plus is offering discounted prices with a minimum of a 2 week stay. This rate includes breakfast, free WiFi and parking, and is valid for rooms with king and double beds. Call the front desk and let them know you are a GK Referral.

fields.name: Comfort Inn Roswell
fields.description: Comfort Inn at Roswell has partnered with Giving Kitchen to offer a minimum seven consecutive night stay for up to (4) people per Queen room, and (2) people per King room at $400 ($57 a night). Breakfast is included. Book by texting Pamela at 678-770-3929; she will enter you into the reservation system. The $400 is due up front at check-in for a seven night stay.

fields.name: HomeTowne Studios Ext. Stay Chamblee
fields.description: Extended stay hotel, rooms discounted $34 per night for singles, and $44 per night for doubles. There is a $50 deposit at check-in. Rates approved through 12/31/2020. Click the provided link to book, and use code GK1 .

fields.name: Dougherty County Neighborhood Service Center
fields.description: Utility assistance for low-income individuals.

fields.name: Home for Good
fields.description: A program of United Way of the Chattahoochee Valley to move individuals or families from homelessness to permanent, stable housing. Complete the intake form and a representative should be in touch within 5 business days.

fields.name: Rental Assistance for Mississippians Program (RAMP)
fields.description: Provide short term rental assistance and are open Monday – Friday, 9AM-6PM

fields.name: Southeast Gwinnett Co-Op
fields.description: Food assistance, limited rent and utility assistance. To be considered, client must have a picture ID, must have a piece of US Postal Mail addressed to you within 30 days of your visit. Mainly food assistance, but can also provide other services. Mondays 4PM - 7PM, Wednesdays, 9AM-12PM, Fridays, 9AM-12PM. Financial assistance is by appointment only. Email Dot Desjardin to schedule an appointment: ddesjardin@segwinnettcoop.org. Serve Snellville: 30078, 30039, Grayson 30017 Loganville 30052 (Gwinnett county section).

fields.name: Atlanta Hospital Hospitality House
fields.description: A small organization with 10 guest rooms - provide patients and/or their family with temporary lodging when they are receiving extended treatments in Atlanta. In order to be considered, a client must live forty miles outside of Atlanta (or more).
fields.address1: 1815 S. Ponce de Leon Ave., NE

fields.name: MLK SRC through Ebenezer Baptist
fields.description: Through its community collaborative partners, the Martin Luther King Sr. Community Resources Collaborative offers wrap around services to individuals and families in the following target impact areas: Employment Services, Family Economic Services, Educational Services, Housing Services and Child/Family Services. In order to receive services, a client must first attend an orientation. Orientations are scheduled once a month from 10AM - 12PM. Visit the website to register for an orientation.

fields.name: United Way of the Chattahoochee Valley
fields.description: United Way serving Columbus and metro Columbus, Georgia. They host multiple programs including Home for Good and prescription assistance, as well as resource referrals.

fields.name: The Ark United Ministry Outreach Center
fields.description: The Ark is a safety net for Athens-Clarke county area residents who are just able to make ends meet until an unexpected job loss (through no fault or decision of their own), reductions of hours, or unexpected medical or auto expense puts them in danger of being evicted and /or losing utilities

fields.name: Metro Fair Housing Services
fields.description: offers services to homeowners who are behind on their mortgage and may be facing foreclosure.

fields.name: One Roof Outreach
fields.description: One Roof Outreach is a religious organization that serves Coweta county residents through food assistance, clothing assistance, financial assistance, and shelter. Financial assistance requires an in person interview, as well as access to The Lodge (One Roof's women and children shelter). Hours are Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 1PM-4PM. The Lodge is a 30 day transitional housing facility for women and children under age 14.

fields.name: Wynnton Neighborhood Network, Corp.
fields.description: Agency provides food, up to 4 times per year with at least 30 or more days since last visit. Agency also provides partial past-due utility (electric and gas only) payment assistance, last $75 only. Utility assistance: account holder must call utility company and give permission for WNN to verify account details.

fields.name: Atlanta Volunteer Lawyers Foundation
fields.description: Promotes access to justice by inspiring volunteer attorneys to provide high-quality education, advocacy, and representation at no charge to low-income families with basic civil legal needs at critical times in their lives. Through its Saturday Lawyer Program, free legal representation is available to eligible tenants in a variety of landlord/tenant disputes. Through this program, the AVLF also provides free legal representation to eligible workers with a claim for unpaid wages against an employer. The Safe Families Office, a collaboration among the AVLF, Partnership Against Domestic Violence, and the Fulton County Superior Court, provides legal assistance and safety planning on a walk-in basis to victims of intimate partner violence and stalking who are seeking to file a Temporary Protective Order in Fulton County.

fields.name: Kanner & Pintaluga Accident Attorneys
fields.description: Law firm committed to representing accident and serious injury victims in various states.

fields.name: Ser Familia, Inc.
fields.description: Support to victims of domestic violence, offering counseling to Spanish speaking clients, immigrants, and refugees (family counseling, couples counseling), furthering education opportunities for Latinx/Hispanic youth, and counseling services. Services are exclusively in Spanish; some workshops require a fee to attend. Ser Familia has four separate locations: Kennesaw, Smyrna, Norcross, and Suwanee. For more information on how to register for services, call the office at (678) 363-3079 to receive a registration form.

fields.name: Georgia Legal Services Program
fields.description: Helping provide cost-efficient legal aid to low-income individuals.

fields.name: New American Pathways
fields.description: Resources and assistance to refugee families in Georgia.

fields.name: TALS – Tennessee Alliance for Legal Services
fields.description: TALS serves as a statewide coordination point for civil justice issues in Tennessee, and connect Tennessee citizens with civil legal help they can afford.

fields.name: Emory University Psychological Center
fields.description: Emory University Psychological Center is a nonprofit outpatient mental health clinic that provides low cost psychological services, both psychotherapy and psychological assessments, for the Atlanta community.

fields.name: DeKalb Community Service Board
fields.description: The program provides housing options for individuals with severe and persistent mental illness who are homeless or have lower income and would benefit from support in a residential setting. Mental Health Residential Services are integrated therapeutic, rehabilitative, skill building and recovery promoting services. Individuals gain the skills necessary to allow them to remain in or return to naturally occurring community settings and activities. This structured supportive housing program is designed to teach residents the independent living skills they need to manage the symptoms of their mental illnesses and to maintain stable housing.

fields.name: The Link Counseling Center
fields.description: The Link offers an initial consultation free of charge to anyone. Family and individual therapy available. After the session, the therapist and the family or individual can talk about what their ongoing needs might be. Further sessions would be based on a sliding fee scale based on what clients are able to pay. Link Counseling fees range from 40 to 100 dollars. Call between the hours of 10AM - 4PM to conduct an initial phone consultation with The Link Counseling Center.

fields.name: Mental Health America of Georgia
fields.description: They enhance the mental health and wellness of Georgians through education, outreach, and advocacy.

fields.name: Georgia State University Psychology Clinic
fields.description: The Psychology Clinic is the primary training site for Georgia State University’s graduate program in clinical psychology. The Clinic offers high quality and affordable psychological services to adults, children, adolescents, families and couples from the greater Atlanta area. Counseling and assessment services are provided by doctoral graduate students supervised by licensed psychologists.

fields.name: Anchor Hospital
fields.description: Anchor Hospital specializes in the treatment of behavioral health and addictive disease disorders for teens, adults and seniors. Anchor Hospital offers inpatient programs for intensive treatment, outpatient services for continuing care, substance abuse treatment plans, and more.

fields.name: Dekalb Regional Crisis Center
fields.description: The DeKalb Regional Crisis Center provides crisis intervention and stabilization services for adults.  The Center offers three level of care starting with the Crisis Services Center unit that receives walk-ins, transfers from emergency rooms, and involuntary referrals for evaluation.

fields.name: Georgia Crisis and Access Line (GCAL)
fields.description: 24-Hour crisis assistance for Georgia residents contemplating suicide.

fields.name: Metropolitan Counseling Services
fields.description: Provides affordable mental health services. MCS therapists see clients on an individual level with a broad array of issues and concerns, including but not limited to: depression, anxiety, stress, relationship issues, childhood abuse and trauma, grief and loss, personal growth, post-traumatic stress, sexual identity/orientation issues, post-recovery addiction issues, and eating disorders

fields.name: Big Table
fields.description: Serving Spokane and Seattle, WA + San Diego, CA. May be willing to assist with utilities assistance, help with rent or a deposit for housing, connections to a counselor, car repair, diapers or food for a single mom, a bike for work transportation, medical or dental help, or assistance with resume development.  They do not provide hotel vouchers or long-term financial assistance.

fields.name: Ridgeview Institute Access Center
fields.description: Ridgeview Institute - https://ridgeviewinstitute.com/programs/ - 844-350-8800 - has two private hospitals (Smyrna and Monroe) treating people with addiction and mental health disorders, serves youth, young adults, adults, and senior adults who need behavioral health and/or addiction intervention, and includes programs specifically designed for women. Programs include: Mental health, substance abuse, and telehealth. Disorders treated: Depression, bipolar, anxiety, substance abuse, drug rehabilitation, PTSD, postpartum depression, suicidal thoughts, psychological trauma.

fields.name: Community Friendship
fields.description: Provide a supportive community for people whose mental illness prevents them from participating in community life, employment and relationships by offering a comprehensive range of services providing educational support, training, skills building, preparation for work, career development and full integration in the community.

fields.name: Cobb & Douglas County Community Services Board
fields.description: Provides citizens challenged by mental health, developmental disabilities and/or addictive disease issues with appropriate care and resources.

fields.name: Heard
fields.description: Organization founded to focus on the mental health of food service workers by offering support groups.

fields.name: Advantage Behavioral Health Systems
fields.description: Advantage Behavioral Health Systems provides person-centered treatment and support to individuals and families experiencing behavioral health challenges, intellectual/developmental disabilities, and addictive diseases.

fields.name: CHRIS180 Counseling
fields.description: CHRIS 180 helps children, young adults, and families through mental health counseling at the CHRIS Counseling Center; group homes for abused and neglected children in foster care; adoption services; a Drop-In Center for homeless young adults; permanent supportive housing program for single and parenting youth, ages 17-24, who are homeless or have aged out of the foster care system; in-home programs; and re-entry programs that work to strengthen families. *To qualify for care, recipients must be currently employed in the restaurant or hospitality industry.  If a care recipient is currently unemployed but can demonstrate they have worked in the restaurant or hospitality industry within the last three months and are actively seeking employment in the industry, a referral will be accepted.

fields.name: Bethel Haven
fields.description: Christian faith-based counseling and therapy on a sliding scale.  Their services include family and marriage counseling, grief counseling, emotional trauma care, and more.

fields.name: Georgia Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Disabilities
fields.description: Statewide effort aiming to connect families and individuals with the proper behavioral health and development resources.

fields.name: Training and Counseling Center
fields.description: TACC offers counseling services on an income-based, sliding scale, and have multiple locations around Atlanta, including Decatur and Roswell. TACC also offers extended hours Wednesday and Thursday each week (until 8PM). Call at 404-876-6266 or schedule an appointment online.

fields.name: Shannon O'Brien-Jones, LPC
fields.description: Sliding scale mental health services available for anyone in the state of Georgia, ages 15 and up (minors must have a parent sign forms). Specializes is trauma, substance abuse, OCD, anxiety, and depression. Sliding scale rate is revisited every (3) months; 50 minute sessions offered weekly or every other week. Email info@shannonjoneslpc.com, or call 404-324-1747 ext. 22

fields.name: Georgia HOPE
fields.description: Georgia HOPE is a community-based provider of mental health, substance use, and family preservation services in the state of Georgia for over 20 years.

fields.name: The Progress Place, Inc.
fields.description: An organization focused on the rebuilding and supporting the youth of Atlanta through programs such as intensive family intervention, out-patient therapy, and psychiatric and medication management.

fields.name: Restaurant After Hours
fields.description: A New York based nonprofit that offers mental health services and support to food service workers / hospitality workers.

fields.name: Atlanta Counseling Center
fields.description: ACC is a private, non-profit, outpatient counseling center treating individual, relational, and family issues. Our staff have unique specialties allowing us to treat clients struggling with a variety of issues. Atlanta Counseling Center operates on an income based sliding scale program.

fields.name: Mental Wellness and Emotional Learning (MWEL)
fields.description: MWEL has a diverse team of counselors who specialize in depression, anxiety, LGBTQIA, substance abuse, trauma, life adjustments, couples, eating disorders & more. Serving children, teens & adults. Flexible private-pay rates available via MWEL initiative or insurance use through Attento Counseling branch. Virtual appointments are now available state-wide, in-person appointments available in Marietta / East Cobb, Cumming, Kennesaw, and Cartersville. GK clients receive a rate of $35 a session.  Please either call/text the number above or email if a callback time needs to be scheduled. Otherwise, once you call/text, a compassionate person will be happy to assist you in pairing you with the best-fitting counselor for your first appointment. 7 days a week, from 8am-8pm. 24 hour response. Online scheduling available at www.mwel.net .

fields.name: NeedyMeds
fields.description: Prescription and medical resource assistance

fields.name: OutPatient Imaging
