fields.description: Discounted Ultrasounds, X-ray, Catscan, MRI, etc.

fields.name: Urban Health and Wellness
fields.description: Free Atlanta based medical clinic for uninsured and Medicaid recipients - must be 18 years or older, must be a metro Atlanta resident, and must be uninsured to be considered for access to services. Urban Health and Wellness offers a variety of primary care services.

fields.name: Disability Connections
fields.description: Provide assistance with information and community resources that relate to disability and community resources/opportunities.

fields.name: Aid Atlanta
fields.description: Clinic in Atlanta that assists with HIV/STI testing, behavioral health, medications and prescriptions, primary care, PrEP, and HIV/AIDS education. They provide comprehensive primary medical care services specifically for patients with HIV. There are two locations: Atlanta and Newnan.

fields.name: Piedmont Cancer Wellness Center
fields.description: Provides comprehensive cancer services and programs to anyone affected by cancer at any phase in their journey free of charge.

fields.name: American Cancer Society
fields.description: An organization that centers itself around cancer research, support services, and education. ACA encourages cancer prevention through healthier lifestyles, connects you to accessible care, and provides support.

fields.name: Family Health Centers of Georgia, Inc.
fields.description: Needs-based primary care, dental care, and women’s care.

fields.name: Whitefoord, Inc.
fields.description: offers a variety of healthcare services (family planning, dental services, adult medicine, pediatrics, and behavioral health) and may be able to assist you with some medications or recommended steps forward/referrals. They also have a sliding scale payment plan you can apply for prior to your visit. Call 404-373-6614 to book an appointment.

fields.name: Fusion Sleep
fields.description: The only complete sleep medicine program in Atlanta. Independent medical practice dedicated to sleep medicine. In home or on site studdies

fields.name: Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
fields.description: Has a program that will work with low-income family (paperwork needed and other tax forms). Financial counselors will work with families with and without insurance

fields.name: HIPNation
fields.description: a healthcare alternative that assigns you to a primary care physician who has 75% LESS patients than most others. They have a network of specialists (orthopedic, chiropractic, etc) that offer services for $120 per visit versus $350 or $400. Also, all primary care is covered through a membership fee of just $100 a month! **(referred to me by a doctor at Resurgens Orthopedic up here in Atlanta)

fields.name: Express MRI
fields.description: $399 MRI - we refer self-pay client sto this location in Peachtree Corners (6050 Peachtree Parkway, Suite 400, 30092) and it is open M-F 8AM-5PM and Saturdays 8AM-2PM. Call – 470-274-3316. They do CareCredit, as well as accept personal checks and/or credit or debit card.

fields.name: American Health Imaging
fields.description: Locations all over Atlanta and surrounding areas. They offer MRI and other services up to 75% less than hospitals.

fields.name: A1 Medical Imaging
fields.description: Called ahead to get an estimate of what the MRIs cost without insurance – for one MRI (IE – just the chest, just one knee, etc) without contrast is $200. One MRI with and without contrast (so two scans, essentially) is $325. They have extended morning and evening hours by appointment, if you need it!

fields.name: Amerigroup - GA
fields.description: Amerigroup - GA helps you get the most from your Medicaid, PeachCare for Kids®, Planning for Healthy Babies® (P4HB) and Georgia Families 360°SM benefits!

fields.name: Athens Nurses Clinic
fields.description: The Athens Nurses Clinic works hard to provide medical services for low- and no-income Georgians in the Northeast Region who do not have health insurance. To fulfill this mission and to meet the requirements for funding, they are bound to certain requirements for accepting patients.

fields.name: Atlanta Cancer Care Foundation
fields.description: The Atlanta Cancer Care Foundation (ACCF) provides critical financial assistance to Metro Atlanta cancer patients that need help dealing with the often overwhelming costs associated with the disease and its treatment.

fields.name: Center for Positive Aging
fields.description: A Georgia initiative to connect people with the proper resources to any aspect of elder care.  They themselves do not offer elder care; reach out for help in accessing the appropriate help for you or your loved ones.

fields.name: Curtis V. Cooper Primary Health Care, Inc.
fields.description: A not-for-profit primary care and preventative health care provider.  There are various clinics in the Savannah area.

fields.name: DeKalb Office of Aging
fields.description: Provides resources and assistance to aging residents of DeKalb County to promote their physical health and well-being.

fields.name: Diabetes Association of Atlanta
fields.description: Offers medical assistance, education, and various resources to those in the Atlanta-area experiencing diabetes.

fields.name: EmpowerLine
fields.description: Connects aging Georgians with the proper resources such as transportation access, at-home assistance, and more.

fields.name: Georgia Department of Public Health
fields.description: Contains various resources and information for Georgians facing any sort of illness.

fields.name: Good Samaritan Health Center
fields.description: Helping those with the least access to healthcare receive the proper medical care in a cost-effective manner.

fields.name: J. C. Lewis Primary Health Care Center
fields.description: Healthcare clinic with multiple locations offering several services including pediatric care, primary medical health care, dental services, behavioral health care services, and outreach and enrollment for affordable care act. Services are provided at an affordable rate to qualifying uninsured, under insured, and people experiencing homelessness with limited income.

fields.name: Jerusalem House
fields.description: Provides housing options to low-income/homeless individuals in Atlanta diagnosed with HIV/AIDS.

fields.name: Loving Arms Cancer Outreach
fields.description: Organization providing support and assistance to individuals diagnosed with cancer and their families.  Services include support groups, financial assistance, and educational resources.

fields.name: MedBank
fields.description: Providing access to prescriptions and medications via low-cost solutions to those in need.

fields.name: Mercy Care of Atlanta
fields.description: Offers a variety affordable medical services, such as dental care, primary medical care, and more, on a sliding scale to those most in need.  Note: not every Mercy Care center offers every service, so check by location.

fields.name: Positive Impact Health Centers
fields.description: Clinic providing medical care to those in need that are diagnosed with HIV.

fields.name: The Full Circle Studio
fields.description: Donation-based wellness classes such as yoga and meditation.

fields.name: BFR Medical
fields.description: Helping those in the Cartersville area with unplanned pregnancies.

fields.name: Physicians Care Clinic
fields.description: Healthcare organization serving clients of DeKalb county with a mission to provide low-income and uninsured adults with access to quality, non-emergency medical care.

fields.name: GivingHealth
fields.description: Affordable telehealth option for primary care purposes. Giving Kitchen has partnered with Giving Health to provide free / zero cost telehealth services to food service workers. To enroll, text gkhealth to 51555. You will receive a response via text - follow the instructions there to set up an appointment.

fields.name: Tanner Health System
fields.description: A five-hospital nonprofit health system providing convenient, personalized health care to communities across west Georgia and east Alabama. Tanner Health System offers financial assistance for care. Ask the Patient Financial Assistance Team any questions or for more information regarding next steps at 770-812-5795.

fields.name: J.O.Y Clinic
fields.description: A volunteer based nonprofit Christian health clinic that provides patient services to those who are employed and without health insurance or those who have been unemployed for 6 months or less and are actively seeking employment. ​ Patients served have a family income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level. Appointments are scheduled following completion of the application process which provides patient information needed for the provision of care and the determination of patient eligibility.

fields.name: Sexual Assault Center
fields.description: Provide advocacy, prevention services, therapy, training, and safe clinic services to children, adults, and families affected by sexual assault. Sexual Assault Center also provides a crisis and support line: 1-866-811-7473 and through online chat services (available 7AM - 11PM in English and Spanish).

fields.name: MercyMed of Columbus
fields.description: A sliding scale clinic that offers an vast array of services, including primary care, mental health, physical therapy, pediatric care, vision services, dental services, and a variety of specialist services, as well as medically ordered meals through the MercyMed Farm! Primary visits can be as low as $30, depending on client's income!

fields.name: Shepherd Center
fields.description: Shepherd Center is a private hospital that admits insured, non-insured, and workers comp patients with brain related injuries. You can make a referral on behalf of your loved one to assess their eligibility and/or receive referrals to other locations.

fields.name: A.G. Rhodes
fields.description: Shepherd Center is a private hospital that admits insured, non-insured, and workers comp patients with brain related injuries. You can make a referral on behalf of your loved one to assess their eligibility and/or receive referrals to other locations.

fields.name: Emory Healthcare Stroke Rehabilitation
fields.description: Emory can assist with transitioning to their rehabilitation hospital. Emory staff works closely with families and referring hospitals to get patients situated into their facility

fields.name: Atlanta Cancer Care Foundation
fields.description: provides critical financial assistance to Metro Atlanta cancer patients that need help dealing with the often overwhelming costs associated with the disease and its treatment.

fields.name: Someone Cares, Inc.
fields.description: A clinic working to eliminate barriers to sexual health for all barriers to health services for all individuals who experience health disparities related to sexual health in primary care, HIV testing, STD and HEP C screening and treatment, and intensive mental health and substance abuse counseling and treatment. Clinic offers behavioral health services, HIV/STD testing, PrEP medications, assistance with domestic violence, women's health, opioid treatment, and transgender hormone therapy.

fields.name: Georgia Council on Substance Abuse
fields.description: They provide and disseminate education and training relevant to the addiction recovery field and acting as a clearinghouse of information on substance abuse prevention, treatment and recovery-oriented systems of care.

fields.name: Art of Living Foundation
fields.description: An international NGO, focused on various dimensions such as social transformation, child education, women and youth empowerment and world peace through yoga meditation, Sudarshan Kriya and other spiritual philosophies.

fields.name: Athens Addiction Recovery Center
fields.description: The Recovery Center provides individual and group therapy, and outpatient treatment for alcohol and drug addiction. They also provide residential treatment assessment & referrals. Their treatment center is not only easily accessible to Clarke and Oconee counties’ residents, but those of surrounding counties as well.  When the treatment plan calls for complex inpatient detox or residential dual-diagnosis treatment services, they can collaborate with Serenity Grove, their affiliated residential detox and treatment center to offer clients and families a continuum of care.

fields.name: Ascensa Health at St. Judes Recovery Center
fields.description: Ascensa Health at St. Judes Recovery Center  – 404-249-6272 – 160 Pine Street NE, Atlanta GA 30308 - St. Jude’s / Ascensa Health offers residential treatment as well as outpatient treatments. If the potential client has dependent children, Ascensa Health at St. Jude’s also has a family care center, allowing an arrangement that keeps the family unit together. Ascensa offers employment services, sober recovery residences, and continuing care programs to support a successful recovery. Individuals seeking admission to Ascensa Health at St. Jude’s Recovery Center may walk in between 8:00am and 10:00am Monday through Friday. All admissions are performed on a first come, first serve basis depending on availability. They welcome professional and non-professional referrals (including self-referrals). Ascensa Health at St. Jude’s Recovery operates on a sliding scale basis, and works with client’s individually on financial obligations.

fields.name: Mary Hall Freedom House
fields.description: A nonprofit organization and national leader in gender-specific treatment, recovery, housing and support services to help women and women with children break the cycle of poverty, homelessness, mental health disorders, and addiction.

fields.name: Women's Clinic of Atlanta
fields.description: Providing reproductive health/sexual healthcare options for women at little to no-cost. Women's Clinic of Atlanta has two clinics - one in Decatur and John's Creek.  Visit their website for the contact information of each location.

fields.name: Southern Equality Fund
fields.description: An emergency assistance fund hosted by Campaign for Southern Equality that provides micro grants of $250 to LGBTQ+ Southerners. Funding can be utilized for basic needs like groceries, rent/mortgage payments, prescriptions or medical bills, prevention supplies, and more. The application opens in rounds, so check back frequently to stay up to date on when the next application round opens.

fields.name: Georgia Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF)
fields.description: The Georgia Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) program is designed to help families achieve self-sufficiency. States receive grants to design and operate programs that accomplish one of the purposes of the TANF program. There is a screener at the end of this website that can help determine your eligibility.
